meanings.definition: The uppermost part of a fish's body, containing the brain and sensory organs.
meanings.sent1: The headfish of the trout helps it sense danger in the water.
meanings.sent2: I saw the headfish of the goldfish peeking out from under the rock.
meanings.sent3: The headfish of the salmon seemed to be the most curious of all the fish in the tank.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a headfish swimming in a sea of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The headfish of the shark was a fearsome sight as it approached.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge or a leader in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: As the headfish of the team, she made sure everyone knew their roles.
meanings.sent2: The headfish of the company guided the employees with wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent3: The headfish of the classroom kept the students engaged with fun activities.
meanings.sent4: In the ocean of ideas, he was the headfish leading the way to innovation.
meanings.sent5: The headfish of the group was respected for their decisive actions.
